reference.shortdesc: Link text is the label for a link or resource.

section.title: Usage information
section.p: The linktext element provides descriptive text for a link. It is most commonly used when the target cannot be resolved during processing or when a title for the reference cannot be determined by a processor. For example, link text might be required when the link is to a peer, external, or non-DITA resource.

section.title: Rendering expectations
section.draft-comment: Pulled this from the "usage" section to have a clearer rendering statement, but it needs editing.
section.p: For processors that can automatically retrieve link text from a target, a specified linktext element is used instead of the retrieved link text.
